# cryptRopen

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Codecov test coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/danielrak/cryptRopen/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/danielrak/cryptRopen)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/danielrak/cryptRopen/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/danielrak/cryptRopen/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of cryptRopen is to allow industrialized datasets encryption, i.e. user wants to encrypt any number of variables within any number of datasets. The design mimics parallel processing, meaning that encryption of all datasets are run independently and at the same time. 

## Installation

You can install the development version of cryptRopen from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("danielrak/cryptRopen")
```
